region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. Region codes are defined at ISO 3166-2 and have a limit of three characters. For example, see the region codes for the US.

logger.caption: Logger
logger.description: The Logger object represents the device and product where events are stored with times for receipt and transmission.  This may be at the source device where the event occurred, a remote scanning device, intermediate hops, or the ultimate destination.
logger.name: logger

device.description: The device where the events are logged.

name.description: The name of the logging product instance.

product.description: The product logging the event.  This may be the event source product, a management server product, a scanning product, a SIEM, etc.

transmit_time.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination

uid.description: The unique identifier of the logging product instance.

version.description: The version of the logging product.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: The Malware object describes the classification of known malicious software, which is intentionally designed to cause damage to a computer, server, client, or computer network.
malware.name: malware

name.description: The malware name, as reported by the detection engine.

path.description: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

provider.description: The provider of the malware information.

uid.description: The malware unique identifier, as reported by the detection engine. For example a virus id or an IPS signature id.

managed_entity.caption: Managed Entity
managed_entity.description: The Managed Entity object describes the type and version of an entity, such as a policy or configuration.
managed_entity.name: managed_entity

data.description: The managed entity content as a JSON object.

name.description: The name of the managed entity.

type.description: The managed entity type. For example: policy, user, organizational unit, device.

uid.description: The identifier of the managed entity.

version.description: The version of the managed entity. For example: 1.2.3.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The Metadata object describes the metadata associated with the event. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Metadata.
metadata.name: metadata

labels.description:
The list of category labels attached to the event or specific attributes. Labels are user defined tags or aliases added at normalization time.

For example: ["network", "connection.ip:destination", "device.ip:source"]

modified_time.description: The time when the event was last modified or enriched.

uid.caption: Event UID
uid.description: The logging system-assigned unique identifier of an event instance.

version.description: The version of the OCSF schema, using Semantic Versioning Specification (SemVer). For example: 1.0.0. Event consumers use the version to determine the available event attributes.

metric.caption: Metric
metric.description: The Metric object defines a simple name/value pair entity for a metric.
metric.name: metric

name.description: The name of the metric.

module.caption: Module
module.description: The Module object describes the load attributes of a module.
module.name: module

1.caption: Standard
1.description: A normal module loaded by the normal windows loading mechanism i.e. LoadLibrary.

2.caption: Non Standard
2.description: A module loaded in a way avoidant of normal windows procedures. i.e. Bootstrapped Loading/Manual Dll Loading.

3.caption: ShellCode
3.description: A raw module in process memory that is READWRITE_EXECUTE and had a thread started in its range.

4.caption: Mapped
4.description: A memory mapped file, typically created with CreatefileMapping/MapViewOfFile.

5.caption: NonStandard Backed
5.description: A module loaded in a non standard way. However, GetModuleFileName succeeds on this allocation.

type.description: The module type.

network_connection_info.caption: Network Connection Information
network_connection_info.description: The Network Connection Information object describes characteristics of a network connection. Defined by D3FEND d3f:NetworkSession.
network_connection_info.name: network_connection_info

uid.caption: Connection UID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the connection.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: The Network Endpoint object describes characteristics of a network endpoint. These can be a source or destination of a network connection.
network_endpoint.name: network_endpoint

proxy_endpoint.description: The network proxy information pertaining to a specific endpoint. This can be used to describe information pertaining to network address translation (NAT).

port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

type.description: The network endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

network_interface.caption: Network Interface
network_interface.description: The Network Interface object describes the type and associated attributes of a network interface.
network_interface.name: network_interface

hostname.description: The hostname associated with the network interface.

ip.description: The IP address associated with the network interface.

mac.description: The MAC address of the network interface.

name.description: The name of the network interface.

type.description: The type of network interface.

uid.description: The unique identifier for the network interface.

network_proxy.caption: Network Proxy Endpoint
network_proxy.name: network_proxy
network_proxy.description: The network proxy endpoint object describes a proxy server, which acts as an intermediary between a client requesting a resource and the server providing that resource. Defined by D3FEND d3f:ProxyServer.

network_traffic.caption: Network Traffic
network_traffic.description: The Network Traffic object describes characteristics of network traffic. Network traffic refers to data moving across a network at a given point of time. Defined by D3FEND d3f:NetworkTraffic.
network_traffic.name: network_traffic

chunks.description: The total number of chunks (in and out).

chunks_in.description: The number of chunks sent from the destination to the source.

chunks_out.description: The number of chunks sent from the source to the destination.

object.caption: Object
object.description: An unordered collection of attributes. It defines a set of attributes available in all objects. It can be also used as a generic object to log objects that are not otherwise defined by the schema.
object.name: object

observable.caption: Observable
observable.description: The observable object is a pivot element that contains related information found in many places in the event.
observable.name: observable

name.description: The full name of the observable attribute. The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the event data. For example: file.name.

type.description: The observable value type name.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The observable data type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain data source specific value.

value.description:
The value associated with the observable attribute. The meaning of the value depends on the observable type.
If the name refers to a scalar attribute, then the value is the value of the attribute.
If the name refers to an object attribute, then the value is not populated.

organization.caption: Organization
organization.description: The Organization object describes characteristics of an organization or company and its division if any.
organization.name: organization

name.description: The name of the organization. For example, Widget, Inc.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization. For example, its Active Directory or AWS Org ID.

os.caption: Operating System (OS)
os.description: The Operating System (OS) object describes characteristics of an OS, such as Linux or Windows. Defined by D3FEND d3f:OperatingSystem.
os.name: os

country.description: The operating system country code, as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard (Alpha-2 code). For the complete list of country codes, see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

name.description: The operating system name.

type.description: The type of the operating system.

type_id.description: The type identifier of the operating system.

version.description: The version of the OS running on the device that originated the event. For example: "Windows 10", "OS X 10.7", or "iOS 9".

package.caption: Software Package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package. Defined by D3FEND d3f:SoftwarePackage.
package.name: package

license.description: The software license applied to this package.

name.description: The software package name.

version.description: The software package version.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.name: peripheral_device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device object describes the identity, vendor and model of a peripheral device.

class.description: The class of the peripheral device.

name.description: The name of the peripheral device.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the peripheral device.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description:
The Policy object describes the policies that are applicable.

Policy attributes provide traceability to the operational state of the security product at the time that the event was captured, facilitating forensics, troubleshooting, and policy tuning/adjustments.
policy.name: policy

desc.description: The description of the policy.

name.description: The policy name. For example: IAM Policy.

uid.description: A unique identifier of the policy instance.

version.description: The policy version number.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Process.
process.name: process

created_time.description: The time when the process was created/started.

name.description: The friendly name of the process, for example: Notepad++.

session.description: The user session under which this process is running.

terminated_time.description: The time when the process was terminated.

uid.description: A unique identifier for this process assigned by the producer (tool).  Facilitates correlation of a process event with other events for that process.

user.description: The user under which this process is running.

xattributes.description: An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs that represent a process extended attribute.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The Product object describes characteristics of a software product.
product.name: product

name.description: The name of the product.

path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the product.

vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor of the product.

version.description: The version of the product, as defined by the event source. For example: 2013.1.3-beta.

query_info.caption: Query Information
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a query must be written using a specific syntax.
query_info.name: query_info

query_time.description: The time when the query was run.

query_string.caption: Query String
query_string.description: A string representing the query code being run. For example: SELECT * FROM my_table

data.description: The data returned from the query execution.

bytes.description: The size of the data returned from the query.

name.description: The query name for a saved or scheduled query.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the query.

related_event.caption: Related Event
related_event.description: The Related Event object describes an event related to a finding or detection as identified by the security product.
related_event.name: related_event

product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the related event.

type.description: The type of the related event. For example: Process Activity: Launch.

type_uid.description: The unique identifier of the related event type. For example: 100701.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the related event.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.description: The Remediation object describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).
remediation.name: remediation

desc.description: The description of the remediation strategy.

references.description: A list of supporting URL/s, references that help describe the remediation strategy.

reputation.caption: Reputation
reputation.description: The Reputation object describes the reputation/risk score of an entity (e.g. device, user, domain).
reputation.name: reputation

base_score.caption: Reputation Score
base_score.description: The reputation score as reported by the event source.

provider.description: The provider of the reputation information.

request.caption: Request Elements
request.description: The Request Elements object describes characteristics of an API request.
request.name: request

data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api request.

uid.description: The unique request identifier.

resource_details.caption: Resource Details
resource_details.description: The Resource Details object describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.
resource_details.name: resource_details

criticality.description: The criticality of the resource as defined by the event source.

group.description: The name of the related resource group.

namespace.description: The namespace is useful when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the resource.

region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

version.description: The version of the resource. For example 1.2.3.

response.caption: Response Elements
response.description: The Response Elements object describes characteristics of an API response.
response.name: response

data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api response.

rpc_interface.caption: RPC Interface
rpc_interface.name: rpc_interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface represents the remote procedure call interface used in the DCE/RPC session.

uuid.description: The unique identifier of the particular remote procedure or service.

version.description: The version of the DCE/RPC protocol being used in the session.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.description: The Rule object describes characteristics of a rule associated with a policy or an event.
rule.name: rule

desc.description: The description of the rule that generated the event.

name.description: The name of the rule that generated the event.

type.description: The rule type.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the rule that generated the event.

version.description: The rule version. For example: 1.1.

san.caption: Subject Alternative Name
san.description: The Subject Alternative name (SAN) object describes a SAN secured by a digital certificate
san.name: san

name.description: Name of SAN (e.g. The actual IP Address or domain.)

type.description: Type descriptor of SAN (e.g. IP Address/domain/etc.)

scan.caption: Scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a proactive scan.
scan.name: scan

name.description: The administrator-supplied or application-generated name of the scan. For example: "Home office weekly user database scan", "Scan folders for viruses", "Full system virus scan"

type.description: The type of scan.

type_id.description: The type id of the scan.

1.description: The scan was manually initiated by the user or administrator.
1.caption: Manual

2.description: The scan was started based on scheduler.
2.caption: Scheduled

3.description: The scan was triggered by a content update.
3.caption: Updated Content

4.description: The scan was triggered by newly quarantined items.
4.caption: Quarantined Items

5.description: The scan was triggered by the attachment of removable media.
5.caption: Attached Media

6.description: The scan was started due to a user logon.
6.caption: User Logon

7.description: The scan was triggered by an Early Launch Anti-Malware (ELAM) detection.
7.caption: ELAM

99.caption: Other
99.description: The scan type id is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.description: The application-defined unique identifier assigned to an instance of a scan.
uid.caption: Scan UID

security_state.caption: Security State
security_state.description: The Security State object describes the security related state of a managed entity.
security_state.name: security_state

state.caption: Security State
state.description: The security state, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

state_id.caption: Security State ID
state_id.description: The security state of the managed entity.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains data source specific values.

1.caption: Missing or outdated content
1.description: The content is missing or outdated.

2.caption: Policy mismatch
2.description: Not in compliance with the expected security policy.

3.caption: In network quarantine
3.description: Isolated from the network.

4.caption: Protection off
4.description: Not protected by a security solution.

5.caption: Protection malfunction
5.description: The security solution is not functioning properly.

6.caption: Protection not licensed
6.description: The security solution does not have a valid license.

7.caption: Unremediated threat
7.description: A detected threat has not been remediated.

8.caption: Suspicious reputation
8.description: Reputation of the entity is suspicious.

9.caption: Reboot pending
9.description: A reboot is required for one or more pending actions.

10.caption: Content is locked
10.description: The content is locked to a specific version.

13.caption: SafetyNet failure
13.description: The device has failed the SafetyNet check.

14.caption: Failed boot verify
14.description: The device has failed the boot verification process.

15.caption: Modified execution environment
15.description: The execution environment has been modified.

16.caption: SELinux disabled
16.description: The SELinux security feature has been disabled.

17.caption: Elevated privilege shell
17.description: An elevated privilege shell has been detected.

18.caption: iOS file system altered
18.description: The file system has been altered on an iOS device.

20.caption: OTA updates disabled
20.description: Mobile OTA (Over The Air) updates have been disabled.

21.caption: Rooted
21.description: The device has been modified to allow root access.

22.caption: Android partition modified
22.description: The Android partition has been modified.

23.caption: Compliance failure
23.description: The entity is not compliant with the associated security policy.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The Service object describes characteristics of a service, e.g. AWS EC2.
service.name: service

labels.description: The list of labels associated with the service.

name.description: The name of the service.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the service.

version.description: The version of the service.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The Session object describes details about an authenticated session. e.g. Session Creation Time, Session Issuer. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Session.
session.name: session

count.description: The number of identical sessions spawned from the same source IP, destination IP, application, and content/threat type seen over a period of time.

created_time.description: The time when the session was created.

expiration_reason.description: The reason which triggered the session expiration.

issuer.description: The identifier of the session issuer.

terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal associated with the session. Ex: the tty or pts value.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the session.

uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier of the session. e.g. AWS ARN - arn:aws:sts::123344444444:assumed-role/Admin/example-session.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the session.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.
sub_technique.name: sub_technique

name.description: The name of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Scanning IP Blocks.

src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/001/.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1595.001.

table.caption: Table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.
table.name: table

created_time.description: The time when the table was known to have been created.

modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the table.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the table.

size.description: The size of the data table in bytes.

groups.description: The group names to which the table belongs.

name.description: The table name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the table.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.
tactic.name: tactic

name.description: The tactic name that is associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Reconnaissance.

src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack tactic, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/tactics/TA0043/.

uid.description: The tactic ID that is associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: TA0043.

technique.caption: Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.
technique.name: technique

name.description: The name of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Active Scanning.

src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1595.

tls.caption: Transport Layer Security (TLS)
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) object describes the negotiated TLS protocol used for secure communications over an establish network connection.
tls.name: tls

version.description: The TLS protocol version.

tls_extension.caption: TLS Extension
tls_extension.description: The TLS Extension object describes additional attributes that extend the base Transport Layer Security (TLS) object.
tls_extension.name: tls_extension

data.description: The data contains information specific to the particular extension type.

type.description: The TLS extension type. For example: Server Name.

type_id.description: The TLS extension type identifier. See The Transport Layer Security (TLS) extension page.

1.caption: maximum_fragment_length
1.description: The Maximum Fragment Length Negotiation extension.

5.caption: status_request
5.description: The Certificate Status Request extension.

14.caption: use_srtp
14.description: The Use SRTP data protection extension.

45.caption: psk_key_exchange_modes
45.description: The Pre-Shared Key Exchange Modes extension.

url.caption: Uniform Resource Locator
url.description: The Uniform Resource Locator(URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL. Defined in RFC 1738 and by D3FEND d3f:URL.
url.name: url

hostname.description: The URL host as extracted from the URL. For example: www.example.com from www.example.com/download/trouble.

path.description: The URL path as extracted from the URL. For example: /download/trouble from www.example.com/download/trouble.

resource_type.description: The context in which a resource was retrieved in a web request.

url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe. Note: The URL path should not populate the URL string.

user.caption: User
user.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.
user.name: user

account.description: The user's account or the account associated with the user.

domain.description: The domain where the user is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

groups.description: The administrative groups to which the user belongs.

ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

name.description: The username. For example, janedoe1.

org.description: Organization and org unit related to the user.

type.description: The type of the user. For example, System, AWS IAM User, etc.

1.caption: User
1.description: Regular user account.

2.caption: Admin
2.description: Admin/root user account.

3.caption: System
3.description: System account. For example, Windows computer accounts with a trailing dollar sign ($).

uid.description: The unique user identifier. For example, the Windows user SID, ActiveDirectory DN or AWS user ARN.

uid_alt.description: The alternate user identifier. For example, the Active Directory user GUID or AWS user Principal ID.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability is an unintended characteristic of a computing component or system configuration that multiplies the risk of an adverse event or a loss occurring either due to accidental exposure, deliberate attack, or conflict with new system components.
vulnerability.name: vulnerability

desc.description: The description of the vulnerability.

first_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

last_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerability.

remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to mitigate the identified vulnerability.

severity.description: The vendor assigned severity of the vulnerability.

title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the discovered vulnerability.

vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that identified the vulnerability.

web_resource.caption: Web Resource
web_resource.description: The Web Resource object describes characteristics of a web resource that was affected by the activity/event.
web_resource.name: web_resource

data.description: Details of the web resource, e.g, file details, search results or application-defined resource.

desc.description: Description of the web resource.

name.description: The name of the web resource.

type.description: The web resource type as defined by the event source.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the web resource.

url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the source of the web resource.

categories_meta.caption: Categories
categories_meta.name: category
categories_meta.description: The OCSF categories organize event classes, each aligned with a specific domain or area of focus.

findings.caption: Findings
findings.description: Findings events report findings, detections, and possible resolutions of malware, anomalies, or other actions performed by security products.

iam.caption: Identity & Access Management
iam.description: Identity & Access Management (IAM) events relate to the supervision of the system's authentication and access control model. Examples of such events are the success or failure of authentication, granting of authority, password change, entity change, privileged use etc.

discovery.caption: Discovery
discovery.description: Discovery events report the existence and state of devices, files, configurations, processes, registry keys, and other objects.

application.caption: Application Activity
application.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

dictionary.caption: Attribute Dictionary
dictionary.description: The Attribute Dictionary defines attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
dictionary.name: dictionary

access_list.caption: Access List
access_list.description: The list of requested access rights.

access_mask.caption: Access Mask
access_mask.description: The access mask in a platform-native format.

access_result.caption: Access Check Result
access_result.description: The list of access check results.

accessed_time.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

accessor.caption: Accessor
accessor.description: The name of the user who last accessed the object.

account.caption: Account
account.description: The account object describes details about the account that was the source or target of the activity.

ack_reason.caption: Acknowledgement Reason
ack_reason.description: An integer that provides a reason code or additional information about the acknowledgment result.

ack_result.caption: Acknowledgement Result
ack_result.description: An integer that denotes the acknowledgment result of the DCE/RPC call.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

action.caption: Action
action.description: The normalized caption of 'action_id' or the source specific action.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The normalized action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

actual_permissions.caption: Actual Permissions
actual_permissions.description: The permissions that were granted to the in a platform-native format.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.description: List of Affected Code objects that describe details about code blocks identified as vulnerable.

affected_packages.caption: Affected Software Packages
affected_packages.description: List of software packages identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

alert.caption: Client TLS Alert
alert.description: The integer value of TLS alert if present. The alerts are defined in the TLS specification in RFC-2246.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The applicable algorithm, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. See specific usage.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized algorithm. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

app.caption: Application
app.description: The application that reported the event.

app_name.caption: Application Name
app_name.description: The name of the application that is associated with the event or object.

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

args.caption: HTTP Arguments
args.description: The arguments sent along with the HTTP request.

assignee.caption: Assignee
assignee.description: The details of the user assigned to an Incident.

assignee_group.caption: Assignee Group
assignee_group.description: The details of the group assigned to an Incident.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

attributes.caption: Attributes
attributes.description: The bitmask value that represents the file attributes.

auth_protocol.caption: Auth Protocol
auth_protocol.description: The authentication protocol as defined by the caption of 'auth_protocol_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.caption: Auth Protocol ID
auth_protocol_id.description: The normalized identifier of the authentication protocol used to create the user session.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The authentication protocol is not mapped. See the auth_protocol attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

auth_type.caption: Authentication Type
auth_type.description: The agreed upon authentication type, normalized to the caption of 'auth_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

auth_type_id.caption: Authentication Type ID
auth_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the agreed upon authentication type. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The authentication type is not mapped. See the auth_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

autoscale_uid.caption: Autoscale UID
autoscale_uid.description: The unique identifier of the cloud autoscale configuration.

banner.caption: SMTP Banner
banner.description: The initial SMTP connection response that a messaging server receives after it connects to a email server.

base_address.caption: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The base score as reported by the event source. See specific usage.

bios_ver.caption: BIOS Version
bios_ver.description: The BIOS version. For example: LENOVO G5ETA2WW (2.62).

boundary.caption: Boundary
boundary.description:
The boundary of the connection, normalized to the caption of 'boundary_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-boundary(same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.

boundary_id.caption: Boundary ID
boundary_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the boundary of the connection.

For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-boundary (same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The boundary is not mapped. See the boundary attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Localhost
1.description: Local network traffic on the same endpoint.

10.caption: Gateway VPC
10.description: Through a gateway VPC endpoint (Nitro-based instances only)

11.caption: Internet Gateway
11.description: Through an Internet gateway (Nitro-based instances only)

2.caption: Internal
2.description: Internal network traffic between two endpoints inside network.

3.caption: External
3.description: External network traffic between two endpoints on the Internet or outside the network.

4.caption: Same VPC
4.description: Through another resource in the same VPC

5.caption: Internet/VPC Gateway
5.description: Through an Internet gateway or a gateway VPC endpoint

6.caption: Virtual Private Gateway
6.description: Through a virtual private gateway

7.caption: Intra-region VPC
7.description: Through an intra-region VPC peering connection

8.caption: Inter-region VPC
8.description: Through an inter-region VPC peering connection

bytes.caption: Total Bytes
bytes.description: The total number of bytes (in and out).

bytes_in.caption: Bytes In
bytes_in.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source.

bytes_out.caption: Bytes Out
bytes_out.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination.

caption.caption: Caption
caption.description: A short description or caption of the device. For example: Scanner 1 or Database Manager.

categories.caption: Website Categorization
categories.description: The Website categorization names, as defined by category_ids enum values.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The object category. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The Domain/URL category is not mapped. See the categories attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

cc.caption: Cc
cc.description: The email header Cc values, as defined by RFC 5322.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.

certificate_chain.caption: Certificate Chain
certificate_chain.description: The Chain of Certificate Serial Numbers field provides a chain of Certificate Issuer Serial Numbers leading to the Root Certificate Issuer.

chassis.caption: Chassis
chassis.description: The chassis type describes the system enclosure or physical form factor. Such as the following examples for Windows Windows Chassis Types

chunks.caption: Chunks
chunks.description: A unit of information within an SCTP packet, consisting of a chunk header and chunk-specific content. See RFC 4960. This field can be used for the total number of chunks (in and out).

chunks_in.caption: Chunks In
chunks_in.description: A unit of information within an SCTP packet, consisting of a chunk header and chunk-specific content. See RFC 4960. This field can be used for the chunks sent from the destination to the source.

chunks_out.caption: Chunks Out
chunks_out.description: A unit of information within an SCTP packet, consisting of a chunk header and chunk-specific content. See RFC 4960. This field can be used for the chunks sent from the source to the destination.

cis_benchmark.caption: CIS Benchmark
cis_benchmark.description: The CIS Benchmark describes best practices for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure as defined by the Center for Internet Security (CIS).

cis_csc.caption: CIS CSC
cis_csc.description: The CIS Critical Security Controls is a list of top 20 actions and practices an organization’s security team can take on such that cyber attacks or malware, are minimized and prevented.

cis_controls.caption: CIS Controls
cis_controls.description: The CIS Critical Security Controls is a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

class.caption: Class
class.description: The class name of the object. See specific usage.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A Class describes the attributes available in an event.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the malware classifications. Reference: STIX Malware Types

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The classification as defined by the vendor.

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

client_ciphers.caption: Client Cipher Suites
client_ciphers.description: The client cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

client_dialects.caption: Client Dialects
client_dialects.description: The list of SMB dialects that the client speaks.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response sent to a request.

codes.caption: Response Codes
codes.description: The list of numeric responses sent to a request.

company_name.caption: Company Name
company_name.description: The name of the company that published the file. For example: Microsoft Corporation.

compliance.caption: Compliance
compliance.description: The compliance object provides context to compliance findings (e.g., a check against a specific regulatory or best practice framework such as CIS, NIST etc.) and contains compliance related details.

component.caption: Component
component.description:
The name or relative pathname of a sub-component of the data object, if applicable.

For example: attachment.doc, attachment.zip/bad.doc, or part.mime/part.cab/part.uue/part.doc.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence Id
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

content_type.caption: HTTP Content Type
content_type.description: The request header that identifies the original media type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

correlation_uid.caption: Correlation UID
correlation_uid.description: The unique identifier used to correlate events.

cost_center.caption: Cost Center
cost_center.description: The cost center associated with the user.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

cpu_cores.caption: CPU Cores
cpu_cores.description: The number of processor cores in all installed processors. For Example: 42.

cpu_count.caption: CPU Count
cpu_count.description: The number of physical processors on a system. For example: 1.

cpu_speed.caption: Processor Speed
cpu_speed.description: The speed of the processor in Mhz. For Example: 4200.

cpu_type.caption: Processor Type
cpu_type.description: The processor type. For example: x86 Family 6 Model 37 Stepping 5.

create_mask.caption: Create Mask
create_mask.description: The original Windows mask that is required to create the object.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the object was created. See specific usage.

creator.caption: Creator
creator.description: The user that created the object associated with event. See specific usage.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

criticality.caption: Criticality
criticality.description: Criticality of a resource/object in question

security_level.caption: Security Level
security_level.description: The current security level of the entity

security_level_id.caption: Security Level ID
security_level_id.description: The current security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

security_states.caption: Security States
security_states.description: The current security states. See specific usage.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

cves.caption: CVE List
cves.description: List of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

@deprecated.message: Use the cwe object attributes instead.

cwe_uid.caption: CWE UID
cwe_uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) unique identifier. For example: CWE-787.

@deprecated.message: Use the cwe object attributes instead.

cwe_url.caption: CWE URL
cwe_url.description: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) definition URL. For example: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/787.html.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the event or object. See specific usage.

database.caption: Database
database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.description: The data bucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

data_sources.caption: Data Sources
data_sources.description: A list of data sources utilized in generation of the finding.

dce_rpc.caption: Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call (DCE/RPC)
dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments.

decision.caption: Authorization Decision/Outcome
decision.description: Decision/outcome of the authorization mechanism (e.g. Approved, Denied)

delay.caption: Root Delay
delay.description: The total round-trip delay to the reference clock in milliseconds.

deleted_time.caption: Deleted Time
deleted_time.description: The timestamp when the user was deleted. In Active Directory (AD), when a user is deleted they are moved to a temporary container and then removed after 30 days. So, this field can be populated even after a user is deleted for the next 30 days.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display
desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event

details.caption: Details
details.description: Details of an entity. See specific usage

detection_uid.caption: Detection UID
detection_uid.description: The associated unique detection event identifier. For example: detection response events include the Detection ID of the original event.

developer_uid.caption: Developer UID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

devices.caption: Devices
devices.description: The object describes details related to the list of devices.

digest.caption: Message Digest
digest.description: The message digest attribute contains the fixed length message hash representation and the corresponding hashing algorithm information.

direction.caption: Direction
direction.description: The direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email, normalized to the caption of the direction_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

direction_id.caption: Direction ID
direction_id.description: The normalized identifier of the direction of the initiated connection, traffic, or email.

1.description: Inbound network connection. The connection was originated from the Internet or outside network, destined for services on the inside network.
1.caption: Inbound

2.description: Outbound network connection. The connection was originated from inside the network, destined for services on the Internet or outside network.
2.caption: Outbound

3.description: Lateral network connection. The connection was originated from inside the network, destined for services on the inside network.
3.caption: Lateral

99.caption: Other
99.description: The direction is not mapped. See the direction attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dispersion.caption: Root Dispersion
dispersion.description: The dispersion in the NTP protocol is the estimated time error or uncertainty relative to the reference clock in milliseconds.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

dkim.caption: DKIM Status
dkim.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) status of the email.

dkim_domain.caption: DKIM Domain
dkim_domain.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing domain of the email.

dkim_signature.caption: DKIM Signature
dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.

dmarc.caption: DMARC Status
dmarc.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) status of the email.

dmarc_override.caption: DMARC Override
dmarc_override.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) override action.

dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy
dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.

driver.caption: Kernel Driver
driver.description: The driver that was loaded/unloaded into the kernel

duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

email_addrs.caption: Email Addresses
email_addrs.description: A list of additional email addresses for the user.

email_auth.caption: Email Authentication
email_auth.description: The SPF, DKIM and DMARC attributes of an email.

email_uid.caption: Email UID
email_uid.description: The unique identifier of the email, used to correlate related email alert and activity events.

employee_uid.caption: Employee ID
employee_uid.description: The employee identifier assigned to the user by the organization.

end_line.caption: End Line
end_line.description: The line number of the last line of code block identified as vulnerable.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period. See specific usage.

endpoint_connections.caption: Endpoint Connections
endpoint_connections.description: Contains information about network connection attempts. See specific usage.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

entity.caption: Entity
entity.description: The managed entity that is being acted upon.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

event_code.caption: Event Code
event_code.description: The Event ID or Code that the product uses to describe the event.

evidence.caption: Evidence
evidence.description: The data the finding exposes to the analyst.

evidences.caption: Evidence Artifacts
evidences.description: Describes various evidence artifacts associated to the activity/activities that triggered a security detection.

exit_code.caption: Exit Code
exit_code.description: The exit code reported by a process when it terminates. The convention is that zero indicates success and any non-zero exit code indicates that some error occurred.

expiration_reason.caption: Expiration Reason
expiration_reason.description: The expiration reason. See specific usage.

expiration_time.caption: Expiration Time
expiration_time.description: The expiration time. See specific usage.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.description: The schema extension used to create the event.

extensions.caption: Schema Extensions
extensions.description: The schema extensions used to create the event.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

file_diff.caption: File Diff
file_diff.description: File content differences used for change detection. For example, a common use case is to identify itemized changes within INI or configuration/property setting values.

file_result.caption: File Result
file_result.description: The result of the file change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

finding.caption: Finding
finding.description: The Finding object provides details about a finding/detection generated by a security tool.

finding_info.caption: Finding Information
finding_info.description: Describes the supporting information about a generated finding.

finding_info_list.caption: Finding Information List
finding_info_list.description: A list of finding_info objects associated to an incident.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The digital fingerprint associated with an object.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: An array of digital fingerprint objects.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The initial detection time of the activity or object. See specific usage

fixed_in_version.caption: Fixed In Version
fixed_in_version.description: The software package version in which a reported vulnerability was patched/fixed.

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

flag_ids.caption: Communication Flag IDs
flag_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the communication flag IDs.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

folder.caption: Folder
folder.description: The folder that pertains to the event.

from.caption: From
from.description: The email header From values, as defined by RFC 5322.

full_name.caption: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name of the person, as per the LDAP Common Name attribute (cn).

function_keys.caption: Function Keys
function_keys.description: The number of function keys on client keyboard.

function_name.caption: Function Name
function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.

given_name.caption: Given Name
given_name.description: The given or first name of the user.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group object associated with an entity such as user, policy, or rule.

group_name.caption: Group Name
group_name.description: The name of the group that the resource belongs to.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The groups to which an entity belongs. See specific usage.

handshake_dur.caption: Handshake Duration
handshake_dur.description: The amount of total time for the TLS handshake to complete after the TCP connection is established, including client-side delays, in milliseconds.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: The hash attribute is the value of a digital fingerprint including information about its algorithm.

hire_time.caption: Hire Time
hire_time.description: The timestamp when the user was or will be hired by the organization.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname of an endpoint or a device.

http_cookies.caption: HTTP Cookies
http_cookies.description: The cookies object describes details about HTTP cookies

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

http_method.caption: HTTP Method
http_method.description:
The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. Expected values:
  • TRACE
  • CONNECT
  • OPTIONS
  • HEAD
  • DELETE
  • POST
  • PUT
  • GET

http_only.caption: HTTP Only
http_only.description: A cookie attribute to make it inaccessible via JavaScript

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: The HTTP Request Object documents attributes of a request made to a web server.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: The HTTP Response from a web server to a requester.

http_status.caption: HTTP Status
http_status.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) status code returned to the client.

hypervisor.caption: Hypervisor
hypervisor.description: The name of the hypervisor running on the device. For example, Xen, VMware, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc.

identifier_cookie.caption: Identifier Cookie
identifier_cookie.description: The client identifier cookie during client/server exchange.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.description: This object describes details about the Identity Provider used.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run a container or virtual machine.

ime.caption: IME
ime.description: The Input Method Editor (IME) file name.

imei.caption: IMEI
imei.description: The International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier that is associated with the device.

impact.caption: Impact
impact.description: The impact , normalized to the caption of the impact_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

impact_id.caption: Impact ID
impact_id.description: The normalized impact of the finding.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The impact is not mapped. See the impact attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

impact_score.caption: Impact
impact_score.description: The impact of the finding, valid range 0-100.

injection_type.caption: Injection Type
injection_type.description: The process injection method, normalized to the caption of the injection_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

injection_type_id.caption: Injection Type ID
injection_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process injection method.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The injection type is not mapped. See the injection_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

integrity.caption: Integrity
integrity.description: The process integrity level, normalized to the caption of the direction_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source (Windows only).

integrity_id.caption: Integrity Level
integrity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process integrity level (Windows only).

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

invoked_by.caption: Invoked by
invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

is_cleartext.caption: Cleartext Credentials
is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.

is_compliant.caption: Compliant Device
is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_exploit_available.caption: Exploit Availability
is_exploit_available.description: Indicates if an exploit or a PoC (proof-of-concept) is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
is_fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_http_only.caption: HTTP Only
is_http_only.description: This attribute prevents the cookie from being accessed via JavaScript.

is_managed.caption: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_new_logon.caption: New Logon
is_new_logon.description: Indicates logon is from a device not seen before or a first time account logon.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

is_personal.caption: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_renewal.caption: Renewal
is_renewal.description: The indication of whether this is a lease/session renewal event.

is_secure.caption: Secure
is_secure.description: The cookie attribute indicates that cookies are sent to the server only when the request is encrypted using the HTTPS protocol.

is_superseded.caption: The patch is superseded.
is_superseded.description: The vendor patch has been replaced by another.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

is_vpn.caption: VPN Session
is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.

isp.caption: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the issuer. See specific usage.

ja3_hash.caption: JA3 Hash
ja3_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3 string.

ja3s_hash.caption: JA3S Hash
ja3s_hash.description: The MD5 hash of a JA3S string.

job.caption: Job
job.description: The job object that pertains to the event.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kernel.caption: Kernel
kernel.description: The kernel resource object that pertains to the event.

key_length.caption: Key Length
key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.

keyboard_layout.caption: Keyboard Layout
keyboard_layout.description: The keyboard locale identifier name (e.g., en-US).

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels attached to an event, object, or attribute.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

last_login_time.caption: Last Login
last_login_time.description: The last time when the user logged in.

last_run_time.caption: Last Run
last_run_time.description: The last run time of application or service. See specific usage.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The most recent detection time of the activity or object. See specific usage.

latency.caption: Latency
latency.description: The HTTP response latency measured in milliseconds.

ldap_cn.caption: LDAP Common Name
ldap_cn.description: The LDAP and X.500 commonName attribute, typically the full name of the person. For example, John Doe.

ldap_dn.caption: LDAP Distinguished Name
ldap_dn.description: The X.500 Distinguished Name (DN) is a structured string that uniquely identifies an entry, such as a user, in an X.500 directory service For example, cn=John Doe,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

lease_dur.caption: Lease Duration
lease_dur.description: This represents the length of the DHCP lease in seconds. This is present in DHCP Ack events.

leave_time.caption: Leave Time
leave_time.description: The timestamp when the user left or will be leaving the organization.

length.caption: Response Length
length.description: The HTTP response length, in number of bytes.

lineage.caption: Lineage
lineage.description: The lineage of the process, represented by a list of paths for each ancestor process. For example: ['/usr/sbin/sshd', '/usr/bin/bash', '/usr/bin/whoami'].

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The name or identifier of the license applied on package or software. See SPDX License List.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: The Load Balancer object contains information related to the device that is distributing incoming traffic to specified destinations.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. It describes how the module was loaded in memory.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the load type. It identifies how the module was loaded in memory.

loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

loggers.caption: Loggers
loggers.description: An array of Logger objects that describe the devices and logging products between the event source and its eventual destination. Note, this attribute can be used when there is a complex end-to-end path of event flow.

logon_process.caption: Logon Process
logon_process.description: The trusted process that validated the authentication credentials.

logon_type.caption: Logon Type
logon_type.description: The logon type, normalized to the caption of the logon_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The logon type is not mapped. See the logon_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: System
0.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.

10.caption: Remote Interactive
10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.

11.caption: Cached Interactive
11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.

12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive
12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.

2.caption: Interactive
2.description: A local logon to device console.

3.caption: Network
3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.

4.caption: Batch
4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.

5.caption: OS Service
5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.

7.caption: Unlock
7.description: A user unlocked the device.

8.caption: Network Cleartext
8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.

9.caption: New Credentials
9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address that is associated with the network interface.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

manager.caption: Manager
manager.description: The user's manager. This helps in understanding an org hierarchy. This should only ever be populated once in an event. I.e. there should not be a manager's manager in an event.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

message_uid.caption: Message UID
message_uid.description: The email header Message-Id value, as defined by RFC 5322.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The general purpose metrics associated with the event. See specific usage.

mime_type.caption: MIME type
mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the object associated with the event. See specific usage.

module.caption: Module
module.description: The module that pertains to the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: The Network Endpoint object describes characteristics of a network endpoint. See specific usage.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

next_run_time.caption: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The next run time. See specific usage.

nist.caption: NIST List
nist.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework recommendations for managing the cybersecurity risk.

num_network_items.caption: Scanned Network Items
num_network_items.description: The number of network items scanned.

num_registry_items.caption: Scanned Registry Items
num_registry_items.description: The number of registry items scanned.

num_resolutions.caption: Resolutions
num_resolutions.description: The number of items that were resolved.

num_violations.caption: Violations
num_violations.description: The number of times the policy or rule was violated.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

office_location.caption: Office Location
office_location.description: The primary office location associated with the user. This could be any string and isn't a specific address. For example, South East Virtual.

opcode.caption: DNS Opcode
opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.

opcode_id.caption: DNS Opcode ID
opcode_id.description: The DNS opcode ID specifies the normalized query message type.

1.caption: Inverse Query
1.description: Inverse query, obsolete

2.caption: Status
2.description: Server status request

3.caption: Reserved
3.description: Reserved, not used

4.caption: Notify
4.description: Zone change notification

5.caption: Update
5.description: Dynamic DNS update

6.caption: DSO Message
6.description: DNS Stateful Operations (DSO)

open_mask.caption: Open Mask
open_mask.description: The Windows options needed to open a registry key.

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of the organizational unit, within an organization.  For example, Finance, IT, R&D

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.

original_time.caption: Original Time
original_time.description: The original event time as reported by the event source. For example, the time in the original format from system event log such as Syslog on Unix/Linux and the System event file on Windows. Omit if event is generated instead of collected via logs.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
