overall_score.description: The overall score as reported by the event source. See specific usage.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file/object.

package.caption: Software Package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package. Defined by D3FEND d3f:SoftwarePackage.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The packet identifier assigned by the protocol.

packets.caption: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.caption: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.

packets_out.caption: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

parent_process.caption: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of this process object. It is recommended to only populate this field for the first process object, to prevent deep nesting.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

percentile.caption: EPSS Percentile
percentile.description: The EPSS score's percentile representing relative importance and ranking of the score in the larger EPSS dataset.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event.

permission.caption: Permission
permission.description: The IAM permission related to an event

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victim’s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victim’s system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victim’s system.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the mission’s goal.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The kill chain phase is not mapped. See the phase attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

phones.caption: Phones
phones.description: The phone numbers associated with the user

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Describes details of a policy. See specific usage.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The TCP/UDP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

precision.caption: Precision
precision.description: The numeric precision. See specific usage.

prev_security_level.caption: Previous Security Level
prev_security_level.description: The previous security level of the entity

prev_security_level_id.caption: Previous Security Level ID
prev_security_level_id.description: The previous security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the prev_security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

prev_security_states.caption: Previous Security States
prev_security_states.description: The previous security states. See specific usage.

priority.caption: Priority
priority.description: The priority, normalized to the caption of the priority_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

priority_id.caption: Priority ID
priority_id.description: The normalized priority. Priority identifies the relative importance of the finding. It is a measurement of urgency.

1.description: Application or personal procedure is unusable, where a workaround is available or a repair is possible.
1.caption: Low

2.description: Non-critical function or procedure is unusable or hard to use causing operational disruptions with no direct impact on a service's availability. A workaround is available.
2.caption: Medium

3.description: Critical functionality or network access is interrupted, degraded or unusable, having a severe impact on services availability. No acceptable alternative is possible.
3.caption: High

4.description: Interruption making a critical functionality inaccessible or a complete network interruption causing a severe impact on services availability. There is no possible alternative.
4.caption: Critical

99.description: The priority is not normalized.
99.caption: Other

processed_time.caption: Processed Time
processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

profiles.caption: Profiles
profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The TCP/IP protocol name in lowercase, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). See Protocol Numbers. For example: tcp or udp.

protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The TCP/IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). Use -1 if the protocol is not defined by IANA. See Protocol Numbers. For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

protocol_ver.caption: Protocol Version
protocol_ver.description: The Protocol version, normalized to the caption of the protocol_ver_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

protocol_ver_id.caption: Protocol Version ID
protocol_ver_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Protocol version.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The origin of information associated with the event. See specific usage.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a database query must be written using a specific syntax.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

rcode.caption: Response Code
rcode.description: The server response code, normalized to the caption of the rcode_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID
rcode_id.description: The normalized identifier of the server response code. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNS response code is not defined by the RFC. See the rcode attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The DNS response code is unknown.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs supporting the finding/detection.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name or the code of a region. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Describes analytics related to the analytic of a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

related_events.caption: Related Events
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

relay.caption: Relay
relay.description: The network relay that is associated with the event.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

remote_display.caption: Remote Display
remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: General Purpose API Request Object. See specific usage

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask that were requested by the process.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

resources.caption: Resources Array
resources.description: Describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.

response_time.caption: Response Time
response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.description: The rules that reported the events.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The state of the job or service, normalized to the caption of the run_state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the state of the job or service. See specific usage.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

scan.caption: Scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a scan.  See specific usage.

schedule_uid.caption: Schedule UID
schedule_uid.description: The unique identifier of the schedule associated with a scan job.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the event.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

share_type.caption: Share Type
share_type.description: The SMB share type, normalized to the caption of the share_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

share_type_id.caption: Share Type Id
share_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the SMB share type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The share type is not mapped. See the share_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_hello.caption: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing towards the source of an entity. See specific usage.

standards.caption: Security Standards
standards.description: Security standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of code block identified as vulnerable.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

state.caption: State
state.description: The state of the event or object, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

stratum.caption: Stratum
stratum.description: The stratum level of the NTP server's time source, normalized to the caption of the stratum_id value.

stratum_id.caption: Stratum ID
stratum_id.description: The normalized identifier of the stratum level, as defined in RFC-5905.

1.caption: Primary Server
1.description: The highest precision primary server (e.g atomic clock or GPS).

2.caption: Secondary Server
2.description: A secondary level server (possible values: 2-15).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The stratum level is not mapped. See the stratum attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

subject.caption: Subject Details
subject.description: The identifier of the subject. See specific usage.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

surname.caption: Surname
surname.description: The last or family name for the user.

is_suspected_breach.caption: Suspected Breach
is_suspected_breach.description: A determination based on analytics as to whether a potential breach was found.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

table.caption: Table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

technique.caption: Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal. Ex: the tty or pts value.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.

to.caption: To
to.description: The email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.

traffic.caption: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

transaction_uid.caption: Transaction UID
transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage

tree_uid.caption: Tree UID
tree_uid.description: The tree id is a unique SMB identifier which represents an open connection to a share.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier. See specific usage.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

users.caption: Users
users.description: The users that pertain to the event or object.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

user_result.caption: User Result
user_result.description: The result of the user account change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor. See specific usage.

verdict.caption: Verdict
verdict.description: The verdict assigned to an Incident finding.

verdict_id.caption: Verdict ID
verdict_id.description: The normalized verdict of an Incident.

1.caption: False Positive
1.description: The incident is a false positive.

2.caption: True Positive
2.description: The incident is a true positive.

3.caption: Disregard
3.description: The incident can be disregarded as it is unimportant, an error or accident.

4.caption: Suspicious
4.description: The incident is suspicious.

5.caption: Benign
5.description: The incident is benign.

6.caption: Test
6.description: The incident is a test.

7.caption: Insufficient Data
7.description: The incident has insufficient data to make a verdict.

8.caption: Security Risk
8.description: The incident is a security risk.

9.caption: Managed Externally
9.description: The incident remediation or required actions are managed externally.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

vulnerabilities.caption: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: This object describes vulnerabilities reported in a security finding.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability

web_resources.caption: Web Resources
web_resources.description: Describes details about web resources that were affected by an activity/event.

web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result
web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

condition.caption: Condition
condition.description: The rule trigger condition for the rule. For example: SQL_INJECTION.

sensitivity.caption: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

match_location.caption: Match Location
match_location.description: The location of the matched data in the source which resulted in the triggered firewall rule. For example: HEADER.

match_details.caption: Match Details
match_details.description: The data in a request that rule matched. For example: '["10","and","1"]'.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: The rate limit for a rate-based rule.

types.caption: Data Types
types.description: The predefined data types. The data type specifies what kind of data a value can have.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description: The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description: Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, 192.168.200.24 or 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

mac_t.caption: MAC Address
mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

port_t.caption: Port
port_t.description: The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet.
For example:
  • 192.168.1.0/24
  • 2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description: The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.

url_t.caption: URL String
url_t.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.
